concept_definition: A unit of length in the International System of Units (SI), equal to 100 centimeters or approximately 39.37 inches; the base unit for measuring distance.
a unit of length equal to one hundredth of a meter (0.01 m), commonly used to measure short distances
a unit of length in the metric system equal to 1,000 meters (about 0.621 miles).
a unit of linear distance equal to 5,280 feet (approximately 1,609.34 metres); used chiefly in the United States and the United Kingdom
a unit of mass in the metric system equal to one thousandth of a kilogram (0.001 kg), commonly used to measure small weights
A unit of mass in the International System of Units (SI) equal to one thousand grams, approximately 2.20462 pounds.
a metric unit of capacity equal to 1 cubic decimetre (1 L = 1 dm³), commonly used for measuring volumes of liquids
a metric unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a liter (0.001 L)

a unit in a scale used to measure temperature, angles, or levels (e.g., degrees Celsius, degrees of arc); a level or extent of intensity, amount, or rank (e.g., a high degree of skill); an academic qualification awarded by a college or university (e.g., a bachelor's degree).

a unit of temperature on the Celsius scale, equal to one hundredth of the interval between the freezing and boiling points of water under standard conditions (0 °C = freezing point, 100 °C = boiling point); also used as the name of the scale itself
A scale for measuring temperature in which water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees under standard atmospheric pressure; temperatures are expressed in degrees Fahrenheit (°F).
